UserCode.Components
Class RequestBubble

java.lang.Object
  UserCode.Components.RequestBubble
All Implemented Interfaces:
IObservable, IComponent
public class RequestBubble
extends Object
implements IObservable, IComponent

RequestBubble describes the behaviour of an IComponent that is used by a pet that requires to emmit a bubble. This IComponent requires an IObserver which will be informed once a request is made. This is achieve by using the IIntervalRequest class

Version:
3.0
Author:
Chris Williams

componentAction

public void componentAction()
METHOD used to call the unique method this component adds to an IBehaviour. This method is called by the IIntervaleRequest every few seconds which will then notify any IObserver's

getUpdate

public double[] getUpdate()
METHOD: used by the IObserver to return a double of where the current position of the IBehaviour is and where to place the bubble

Specified by:
getUpdate in interface IObservable
Returns:
an array of doubles containing the x,y and z position of the IBehaviour held in the _behaviour class

Initialise

public void Initialise(IBehaviour _b)
METHOD: used to initialise the _intervalRequest field and the _behaviour field. The method calls the generateRequest() method to start the setInterval

Specified by:
Initialise in interface IComponent
Parameters:
_b - the IBehaviour class that this IComponent uses to request a bubble at its current location

notifyObservers

public void notifyObservers()
METHOD: used to notify the IObserver that an event occurred. This method first checks if the _observer field has been assigned

Specified by:
notifyObservers in interface IObservable

removeObserver

public void removeObserver(IObserver _o)
METHOD: used to assign the IObserver field to null and will no longer by 'notified' if an event occurs

Specified by:
removeObserver in interface IObservable
Parameters:
_o - the reference to the IObserver that should be removed

TearDown

public void TearDown()
METHOD: used to stop any operations that are running and inform the IObserver to stop observing this class
